task.title: Add the master host to a resource pool

taskbody.context: Use this procedure to add the master host to a resource pool. You can use a hostname or an IP address to add the master host to a resource pool. If you use a hostname, all of the hosts in your cluster must be able to resolve the name, either through an entry in /etc/hosts, or through a nameserver on the network.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Add the master host to a resource pool.

choices.choice:
If you are creating a single-host deployment, enter the following command.
Replace Hostname-Or-IP with the hostname or IP address of the master host: serviced host add --register Hostname-Or-IP:4979 default

If you are creating a multi-host deployment, enter the following commands.
Replace Hostname-Or-IP with the hostname or IP address of the master host: serviced pool add master && serviced host add \ --register Hostname-Or-IP:4979 master
The commands create a new pool named master, and then add the master host to the new pool. Delegate hosts are added to the default pool, or other pools.
